title: Drunk socialite accused of stripping to thong, hurling dirty diaper on flight
text:
A drunken socialite stripped to her thong and hurled a dirty diaper during a flight from Bangalore , India , to London , with no regard for her toddler son traveling with her, witnesses told a jury Monday.
Clare Irby also was accused of letting fellow passenger Daniel Melia fondle her breasts in full view of passengers as his girlfriend slept on the plane, London's Daily Telegraph reports.
Prosecutor Bill McGivern told London's Isleworth Crown Court that Irby, a descendant of the Guinness brewing family, began drinking red wine shortly after boarding Kingfisher Airlines ' Flight IT001.
Witnesses testified it wasn't long before the 30-year-old had guzzled several drinks and was obviously intoxicated and incapable of looking after her son.
"Her speech was slurred. She was asking for more and more red wine," flight attendant Shivaneji Sharma testified. "She had absolutely no clue about the child, and the way she was behaving was not tipsy, but drunk."
As her child reportedly tore around the cabin nude from the waist down, Irby allegedly got amorous with the 36-year-old Melia.
"The child was all on his own and was crying in the cabin," flight attendant Arpita Mehra testified. "She was busy with the guest sitting behind her.
"They were having a conversation and getting personal with each other and the child was crying.
"The man was leaning forward, grabbing hold of her breast and they were kissing each other."
At one point, crew chief Saloni Khanna testified, Irby was sprawled across four seats with her skirt hiked up above her waist, unaware her child had soiled himself, the Telegraph reports. At that point, Khanna said, the crew took over looking after the child.
After four hours of Irby's alleged antics, the captain ordered her cut off from alcohol, at which point she became abusive toward the flight's staff, according to witnesses' testimony.
Saloni Khanna, the flight's crew chief, testified Irby gave staff the middle finger and repeatedly pushed the call button above her seat, only to heap verbal abuse on the attendants, the Telegraph reports.
After Irby's in-flight paramour, Melia, slapped a fellow passenger and got into an altercation with his girlfriend in the rear of the plane, staff called police who were on-hand at Heathrow Airport for the plane's arrival.
Irby said her memory of the incident was "foggy," and credited drinking on an empty stomach with her level of intoxication, the Telegraph reports, telling cops, â€œI wouldn't normally get drunk like this on this amount of alcohol."
